title: Out-of-Sight Trajectories: Tracking, Fusion, and Prediction
summary: This paper addresses challenges in trajectory prediction due to incomplete and noisy observational data from out-of-sight objects and sensor limitations. It focuses on tracking, fusion, and prediction, highlighting the need for robust methods to handle inherent noise and limited ground truth.
usefulness_reason: The paper discusses "observational data" and "sensor data" in the context of trajectory prediction, which can be considered a form of "Contextual dataset". It also highlights challenges with data quality and completeness, which are relevant to dataset considerations.
